sep.gaia.state

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • sep.gaia.state.StateObservable
        • sep.gaia.state.State
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeoState, GLState, TileState

    public abstract class State
extends StateObservable
    Abstract class to represent and manage the current state of the depiction of the earth. The state generally consists of the coordinates of the map center and of the four corners of the window. It should also save the current zoom level as a numerical value. Every method of this class and inheriting classes that change their internal data must invoke the notifyManager method in order to tell their manager to update the other state representations.
    Author:
    Max Witzelsperger

      • State

        public State()

    • Method Detail

      • isFloat

        public abstract boolean isFloat()
        Method to decide whether the coordinates used to manage the data of this are of the type float. If false is returned, the representation of the internal coordinates of this may be assumed as int.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the coordinates saved in this are of the type float

      • getPosition

        public abstract Vector3D getPosition()
        Gets the current center in form of a 3-dimensional numerical vector of which the first two coordinates represent the center of the current view and the last one is 0.
        Returns:
        the center as a vector of which the coordinate type is float if and only if this.isFloat() is true and can otherwise assumed to be int

      • setPosition

        public abstract void setPosition(Vector3D cen)
        Sets the center of the map in form of a 3-dimensional numerical vector, which must be an instance of FloatVector3D if and only if this.isFloat() is true, otherwise the invocation of this method will be without effect.
        Parameters:
        cen - the new value for the center as 3-dimensional vector which must be an instance of FloatVector3D if this.isFloat() is true and otherwise must be an instance of IntegerVector3D, and of which the z-coordinate should be 0 and will be ignored otherwise

      • getBoundingBox

        public abstract BoundingBox getBoundingBox()
        Gets the current bounding box which represents the circumference of the currently depicted map.
        Returns:
        the bounding box where the coordinates of the corners are of the type float if and only if this.isFloat() is true, otherwise the coordinate type can be assumed to be int

      • setBoundingBox

        public abstract void setBoundingBox(BoundingBox box)
        Sets the bounding box which represents the circumference of the currently depicted map. The given bounding box must be an instance of FloatBoundingBox if and only if this.isFloat() is true, otherwise the invocation of this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        box - the new bounding box for this, which must be an instance of FloatBoundingBox if this.isFloat() is true, and otherwise must be an instance of IntegerBoundingBox

      • notifyManager

        public void notifyManager()
        Notifies the manager of this that this has changed in order to update all the other state representations.

      • type

        public AbstractStateManager.StateType type()
        Gets the enum type of this.
        Returns:
        the type
